page.title: 13MEMORIALS IN LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: St.Marys Church has a beautiful nave which includes 14th century arched recesses in the south wall.These recesses contain 2 wooden effigies which have been skillfully carved and well preserved.They are of a lady and gentleman whose costume dates them from 1340-1350.It is possible that they are of the Filiol family who were strict in their religion.At the feet of these 2 are fine carvings of dogs. On the north side of the chancel is the Mildmay monument.This is a stone effigy that was erected to Sir Henry Mildmay,of Graces Manor,who died in 1639.He is portrayed in a recumbant position,clad in his armour and at his feet are his 2 wives.It is possible that this monument was the work of Nicholas Stone.Some fragments of medieval glass,2 brass inscriptions and a 15th century chest can be seen.
